Reviews.Title: “Weekend away”
Reviews.Author: GrahamGrape
Reviews.Content: I was only staying overnight, in residence halls when the students were away. Overall if you do not mind staying in some what tied decore, the use of communial toilets and showers then for the cost you can't go wrong. I paid the extra £2 for the breakfast, I wasn't expecting much, but got a full cooked English one. The halls are located near Angel underground station, a 10min walk at most. There is good security, and staff were helpful. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Budget Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: scienceladyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the Uni Easter holidays so on our corridor there were a few students left which was was a little noisy on Saturday night. Our room was a twin, which had two firm but comfortable beds, two desks, and a small shower/toilet room and overall was clean and tidy. At the end of the corridor there was a toilet with bath and a separate kitchen area (bring your own crokery/cutlery/pans as these are not provided). Also bring a hairdryer if you need one. We had breakfast included in our rate which allowed 6 items from cooked/continental breakfasts plus tea, coffee, juice and toast and this represented excellent value for money. There are very good transport links including bus and tube connections closeby. The people on reception were very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: demimcgovern
Reviews.Content: Rosebery Hall is a great place to stay in London if you're on a budget. It is located in a good area with easy links to the West-End and only a five-minute walk to the Angel tube station. This is a student accommodation, so rooms are basic but clean. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. The only problem is the Wi-Fi in the dining hall, which is very, very slow and does not work most of the times.

Reviews.Title: “Cool location, great value and a very substantial breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: Sue N
Reviews.Content: A really good location that is very close to central London and served by an excellent bus service. The facilities although basic were clean and the breakfast included in the price was extremely good value. The only snag we encountered was that we arrived very early in the morning and we were given a room already occupied which was rather embarrassing plus there were no towels available so we had to share. Other than that, we would definitely recommend the LSE as exceptionally good value accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: NicOatridge
Reviews.Content: With frequent buses into the West End, trendy Islington 10 minutes walk away and Exmouth market on your doorstep, Rosebery Hall is in a good location. Being college accommodation rooms you would expect room to only be available outside term times, but I have also found them to be available in term times too. The rooms themselves are fine, with shared showers and toilets, but there are washbasins in the rooms. Breakfast is good, with a wide choice of hot and cold food. There is also a bar on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Rosebery Works.”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: What do you do when you’re stuck for a few days in Central London, on a budget, and in dire need of a quiet space to work? Easy answer: look up LSE Vacations online. All their buildings fit the bill, but Rosebery Hall most definitely scores extra points for its superior location, simple, comfy surroundings, and friendly staff. Breakfast (if you choose), can be cooked or cold, and taken in one truly spacious dining room that’s actually better than most 2-3 star hotels. The only down-side is LSE does not open year round, so be sure to check their website for dates. Space can be a little tight near the desk in basic double/twin rooms, and if you’re using the (spotless) shower, let it run first, or it might open with a cold blast! Other than that, relax and let the good times roll.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value for money stay in London”
Reviews.Author: DonMBanbury
Reviews.Content: As a former student of the LSE I had thought that the accomodation would have improved since my student days in the 80s. Evidently not! However, though the accomodation is very functional (no ensuite, basic bed, desk and chair) it does represent great value for money. We paid approximately £70 for a double and a single with a full breakfast. We have also stayed at Passfield Hall which has a better feel to it (less utilitarian) and more central location and I would recommend this hall as well. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Is Good But I Can't Handle With The Shower”
Reviews.Author: SaffuanSalleh
Reviews.Content: Love it at Rosebery. All in perfect condition. BUT, I can't manage with the shower especially in gents toilet. THE SHOWER IS VERY HOT AND CAN NOT BE ADJUST AS THAT IS ONLY HOT WATER THAT THEY PROVIDE TO US. Could you imagine, I stay for 4 night on summer. The problem is when I get sweat after walking around in central London in warm weather and then return back to Rosebery for bath, I feel disappointed with the shower.

Reviews.Title: “basic, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sim T
Reviews.Content: stayed here whilst waiting for a eurostar connection. 5 mins taxi from Kings cross. Check in was easy, even at 0130 hrs! Room was very basic, but very clean and in good condition. Fresh linen and a comfy single bed was all we needed and we got that. There was a wardrobe and a set of drawers and a desk. Shared bathroom was spotless and modern, I was very surprised. Didn't stay for breakfast so cant comment. Was very quiet, didnt hear a thing (and Im a really light sleeper!) somehow managed to get lost in the lower floor of the building while trying to get out (some signs to reception would be handy!) If you're on a budget this is well recommended (as long as you are not expecting amazing things!)...better than a hostel? More privacy for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Terry D
Reviews.Content: As always Rosebery Hall is terrific for a holiday in London; good area; easy links with the West-End, Student accommodation, so rooms basic but clean. This time I was in the newer block and the room was better. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. As it is very popular, book as early as possible. It will get full, with a full age-range.!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Grannyts
Reviews.Content: Accomodation though basic was clean and tidy. All the staff were helpful, Kitchen staff were lovely one even remembered I was going to be a Grandma :)) Excellent value for City Centre location. Well located to get around, plenty of activity and things going on. Only complaint were curtains were hard to pull to keep night light out, blinds helped though

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but it IS a student hall of Residence. Good parking !”
Reviews.Author: Nevis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hall of residence a couple of times, and it is pretty good value for money. Rooms are basic but clean, but the standard of the rooms and bathrooms does vary a lot between different buildings and floors. I've been frustrated trying to book a single room, on both occasions I've had to book a twin room just for myself, even at short notice they will not let you have a twin room at single price. The best thing about this location is the parking. The street to the side of the hall has free parking from the evening until 8 in the morning, and it always seems easy to find a space. This for me is a huge bonus. It's also possible to reach the Hall without going into the congestion Zone, by travelling down the City road - which is right on the edge of the zone. For those that have to bring their car into town, thus is an ideal place to stay

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: GirlfriendinaComaUK
Reviews.Content: Knowing the area where the Rosebery is situated, Clerkenwell, I knew that the rate was a steal. Located near a number of cafes, shops, convenience stores, restaurants, and most importantly pubs, the accommodation is well situated if you know London and are familiar with some of the bus routes. I prefer the bus, but Angel tube station is very easy to get to. Easy access to Shoreditch, the City, Islington, Holborn, Soho, and South Bank. The room was small, but, yes, it's a dorm. I stayed in a single and since I wasn't there a lot, it suited my needs. I did bring my own sleep sack and was glad I did because while the sheets appeared clean, there were quite a few strands of hair sticking to things that weren't mine--ick. Though I didn't have it often, the breakfast was much better than I expected. An array of hot foods, pastries, yogurt, fruit, and cereal. The majority of the staff, by email and in person, were amiable and helpful. Only once did I encounter a girl who couldn't seem to be able to tear her eyes away from a computer monitor to answer a simple question. Things that could've been better: 1. WiFi---I really don't care if I can now use it for free at a nearby cafe. How hard is it to sell vouchers to LSE's basic wifi, which one can pick up in the room and common areas? I've never quite understood why British businesses are averse to making money. 2. Selling water and disabling the drinking fountain in the cafeteria is beyond cheap. Seriously? Water's kind of a necessity for, well, life. 3. A better system for getting a new towel. While I don't need a new one every day, I had to leave a note more than once to get a fresh one. 4. Clean the grout in the showers! I found the bathrooms quite clean, but that grout was mingin', mate. Advice: bring flip flops. Overall, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: Hostile17bm
Reviews.Content: The accomodation was basic & rather cramped and the smell both inside & outside the room was horrific. It actually made me physically sick. They also tried to charge me twice for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but does the job!”
Reviews.Author: Bev M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night while sightseeing in London. The room was fine, basic accommodation but very clean and with comfy twin beds. Shared bathroom and toilet right close by and very clean too. The accomodation is Student accomodation during term time so no TV in the room as it's not really aiming to be a Hotel as such. Breakfasts were fab - plenty to eat. Cooked breakfast, mixed fruit in juice, fresh fruit, cereal, croissants, toast, lots to drink. Couldn't fault it. Easily accessible to the city on the number 19 bus. I would definitely stay again as it's easy to find and bus stops right outside. It's just down from Saddlers Wells Ballet. There are also kitchens that can be used for Self-Catering, but we didn't use them so I can't comment on that. Loads of eating places nearby as it's close to shops etc. There was also a games room with pool table that children used and somewhere there was a TV lounge, but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like at home”
Reviews.Author: camaronex74
Reviews.Content: I loved the area. It's located in the trendy Angel, wihch was bustling with life round the tube station 300mts away but really calm (apart from the main road noise), green and beautiful in the Rosebery Av. where the hall is. It's very well located for sightseeng as you have 3 bus routes which take you to the West End in no more than 15 minutes or if you prefer the tube its just a nice 5 minute walk to Angel tube station. Breakfast is very good, you have a choice of British or continental and the timetable is very reasonable. Our room was simple and clean, just two beds a basing and a mirror. More than enough for resting. We just missed a tv set and wi-fi connection. The only downside about it is, that the room was too exposed to noises from the road, but honestly we slept as logs every night. The shared toilet and shower were cleaned daily but it looked as if we were the only ones using it. So, no bad comments at all for the Rosebery Hall: very good value for money for London standards, helpfull and nice staff and loved the location! I'd come back, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Paula L
Reviews.Content: Basic, clean accommodation. A little noisy, but hey, it's central London! The carpet in my room had a huge iron print on it, but it reminded me of my university days, it is a halls of residence, after all. The location is great, the staff were very helpful and the luggage room was secure and useful to have on my last day. I didn't have breakfast there, but I could see from my window that the canteen was full every morning, so it couldn't be that bad... The showers were a few floors below, would have been nice to have one closer to my room, but they were clean, hot and powerful. All in all,a good stay. Would definitely return - good budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: nlabhart
Reviews.Content: Nice location near Angel station. Room functionally furnished, comfortable beds. Both shared facilities (toilet and shower) were very clean, and shared only with 3 (?) other guests. The shower drain was clogged, but it was not really a problem. No free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money accomodation”
Reviews.Author: J_I_M1267
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights. The room was rather small but clean and tidy. The bed was comfortable and I had a good nights rest. With a window to the court yard it was also very quiet as soon as the bar closed - and also ok before. The bathroom was rather far from my room, but also very clean. I would have wished for a dry place to store your clothes while taking the shower. But alltogether I was quite happy with my stay - especially for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the name, but worth a try if only once”
Reviews.Author: Ryan_Huddersfield
Reviews.Content: Ok, Rosebery Hall sounds nice, and belonging to LSE which is quite a prestigious establishment would set you up to expect at least medium - high standards in terms of the condition of the place.... We stayed for 2 nights (me and wife) and our twin room was on the 7th floor, the halls reminded me of my own Uni halls from a few years ago.... tatty, unpleasant smelling corridors, painted 'exposed' brickwork, a bit prison like! The room itself was fine, bed linen smelled fresh, and towels and soap were provided although the walk to the gents bathroom was right at the end of the corridor, a little further than I'd hoped. However the showers were fine, and hot. Where the place let me down was when it came to sleep quality. Being on the 7th floor there was still a lot of traffic noise from the window (which was shut!), the room was generally hot, and there was constant noise throughout the night of doors banging which meant I had the most disruptive couple of nights sleep I've had in a long time. Breakfast was included and service was good although seemed a little authoritative in that guests can have upto 6 items from the breakfast list, no more than 2 of each and no return visits! Now I don't like wasting food and had to make a judgement as to how hungry I was before going back for that extra croissant/yoghurt/banana for fear of being 'spoken to' ! What the place lacks in sleep quality, it makes up for in location, about 5 minutes walk from Angel tube station, and about 20 minutes walk from Kings Cross St Pancras, but although the money is going to a good cause (subsidising students accommodation fees) I don't think I'd return in the near future unless I was by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, terrific price.”
Reviews.Author: Cambrinus
Reviews.Content: Rosebery Hall Residence is a marvellously comfortable and pretty central experience. Where else can you bump into 40 very lively Dutch visitors and have a copy of Paionios' Nike next door? Seriously though, this is a terrific bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and cosy beds”
Reviews.Author: Cocope
Reviews.Content: The building is like a labyrinth, it was rather hard to find our room and we got lost several times. The room (twin) was very common but clean and with beds I slept very well in! Toilet and shower normally where very close to the rooms and you had to share them only with 2-3 other rooms, what I consider better than having huge bathing facilities you have to share with the whole floor. The staff was very nice. Although the breakfast room was hard to find (as most of the rooms) and located in the basement, it was a very friendly room with view in a small garden (you could also sit outside). They offered quite a big varity of food for breakfast - it was far better than anyone could expect for this price! They offered typical English breakfast (very delicious - I recommend that) but also European breakfast. There was also a bar (not open during our stay) and a pool billiard table but we did not use that. The neighbourhood of Roseberry Hall is beautiful: nearby the house it is rather quiet with nice buildings, very comfortable. Around the next tube station (Angel) there a lots of little shops, little markets, restaurants, pubs and bars. I really recommend a walk to the nearby small river canal: there are cute pubs and many people with their drinks sitting at the bank on evenings. The downside of the location is that public transport connections could be better and for the next tube station you have to walk about 10min (or take the bus instead). Alltogether, rooms at Roseberry were small and common but clean and cosy, breakfast was rich and delicious, and the neighbourhodd of Islington is absolutely worth discovering! I have been staying at another LSE location (Carr-Saunders Hall) before but I liked Roseberry Hall far better.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful well located accomodation”
Reviews.Author: aimzaeon
Reviews.Content: as a member of a running club we have used rosebery avenue residence for quite a number of years(for the london marathon weekend) as it is a good price and local to euston station (2 stops on the tube). the breakfasts are very good , a good variety and plenty of it. they dont do evening meals but there are plenty of eating places on its doorstep and dotted around islington. the bar used to be opened in its clubhouse but for some reason over the last few years this has not been the case which is a shame but there are plenty of pubs and bars locally but it would be better if it was open.

Reviews.Title: “Good locatoin, clean, great value, very nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: thomazuai
Reviews.Content: It is a quite simple accomodation, but great value for the price, rooms are clean and comfortable. Amazing for the price we paid and very near central london. The breakfast is a typical English one, very rich and with many options.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: stebo293917
Reviews.Content: Why no internet for guests? Free wifi is now standard at even the most basic places in London and elsewhere in the world. The incredible thing is that all the rooms do actually have a signal, it's just that the people who run the place won't give you the password. --

Reviews.Title: “Good value but lots of traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: manuelk57
Reviews.Content: Decent value, reasonable location, great big breakfasts! There was constant loud traffic noise that continued through the night though, so probably not so good for light sleepers. Also the automatic showers were a total debacle (although it could've just been me) as the first time I didn't know they were automatic so got completely soaked while wearing my clothes, then later it would turn off and on in a perverse fashion that made me feel like I was in a bad slapstick comedy. Otherwise the room had a resonable amount of space, the place was clean and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: darcleidi
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in April 2011 for two weeks and I definitely enjoyed it. My single room was large , clean sheets, new furniture, only the carpet was dirty and a bit old. The showers and toilets I used were brand new, and sparkling clean. Staff very friendly, I had a problem with my lock and they fixed in in a matter of minutes. And as bonus, I had someone playing the piano wonderfully just next door . Breakfast the same every day but it didn;t matter to me, I was in London to enjoy London only. Close to the bus station ( 30 seconds), bus 38 to/from Vitctoria. Quiet and very safe place. No free wifi but I bought a vodafone dongle for 25 pounds ( 3 gygabytes) which was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent loaction, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: kk2030
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rosebery for 3 weeks on a study trip. The loaction is the first thing one would notice. It's situated in the heart of the city of London, with every major place of interest at a 10-15 min walk or a short bus ride away. The room are comfy. It's quiet during the day, while if you want to socialize at night you need to just head down to the pub on the ground floor. The common bathrooms are actually quite well maintained. Also, the kitchen at the end of each hall is very convenient. Definitely a "no worries" residence hall!

Reviews.Title: “We had fairly low expectations as this is a dormitory....”
Reviews.Author: cindyandted
Reviews.Content: and it wasn't as bad as we thought. One wall was windows which was nice (views). The beds and linens were as expected in a dorm. The bathroom was cold but there was plenty of hot water in the shower. The breakfast was more than one could eat. Again what you would expect from a college cafeteria. The location was excellent. The bus stop was very close to the building. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and a market about 1/2 mile away. I really liked the small town feel of Angel/Islington. The rate at Rosebery was fair for a room in London. I would recommend it but realize it is not terribly new and it is not the Hilton. There was some loud talking outside the building at various times which woke me up but that only happened a few times.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money in London”
Reviews.Author: GillS_10
Reviews.Content: An excellent value for money accommodation and well appointed for both tube & bus, my room was small but clean and well serviced, the breakfast was very good with lots of choice. The Ladies bathroom/shower room was uni sex due to repairs to Gents, which was a little awkward but led to some funny encounters. As a solo traveller I felt very safe and the walk to Old St tube was about 5mins if that. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Cleobella10
Reviews.Content: No frills here but basic, great budget accommodation. Very useful to have a kitchen available. Great location. Excellent transport links and a very handy supermarket a few yards away. Willd definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: evastaub
Reviews.Content: Room was simple but ok. While the carpet in the room was stained and one could tell every day if the shared bathrooms had been cleaned already, it was a fantastic value for London. Great location (bus right outside, tube about a 10min. walk away), clean (except for carpet - but you just wear shoes/slippers), it felt safe at all times, and provided a good breakfast selection (just stay away from the coffee). Unfortunately, there was no free wifi. Nearby Exmouth Street (2 min. walk) has several places that offer though, and I highly recommend the "Brill" cafe. I would definitely stay @ Rosebery Hall again.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: fjrider
Reviews.Content: worst place i've ever stayed at -certainly would not go there again didn't get a wink of sleep all night,it would have been easier to sleep in the street like a tramp.desk staff were miserable and surly and presumably low paid sorry but nothing good to say-except stay clear

Reviews.Title: “Great value for visiting London”
Reviews.Author: argosy2gb
Reviews.Content: Luxury this is not but it offers really good value for money and was clean and comfortable enough for my needs. Breakfast was good and there are kitchens for preparing a meal should you want to. Area is pleasant and there are buses on the doorstep and a couple of underground stations within easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: remplem
Reviews.Content: Rosebery Hall is perfect for a short stay. We stayed for 2 nights with a baby and a toddler and found the rooms and the kitchen to be very clean and comfortable. We were out all day and inly used the halls for sleeping. The breakfast was excellent. However the bathrooms were dirty and unpleasant to use (too many people to one bathroom). One disadvantage for a young family is that students come in late at night and make noise. Perhaps we were unlucky as we were there at the same time as a large group of young people who partied every night until the early hours. On the good side, the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent (including good public transport links). The price is very good for the area. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is good for the value but certainly needs simple improvement”
Reviews.Author: albaloo
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews on Rosebery Hall. I am an LSE student staying here until finding permanent accommodation. Let me start from the staff. The front desk people are quit moody, if you catch them in a bad mood they give you plenty of bad attitude. The breakfast is surprisingly great relative to the shabby rooms and horrible shower/toilets. The building is under construction so the bathroom on my floor was not working. I had to go upstairs or downstairs to use the bathroom. The shower was so dirty that I cringed every time I was taking a shower and I asked several other people and they said the same thing. the location is fantastic. Very close to Central London and King's Cross tube station (one stop over on the Northern line). the room I stayed in was smelly and that's because the carpet was from 1970's, no joke. the bed was also extremely uncomfortable. I could also feel every single spring. and the high light of my stay was when the African worker behind the hot food shouted at me because I was taking a banana on the way out. So I had to go and talk to the manager. This was not pleasant at all. all and all, it was not the best experience but I guess it could always be worse. as another reviewer said lower your expectations cuz this ain't Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “No internet for non-LSE students”
Reviews.Author: HThunder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a twin en-suite for 10 days in August which cost around 70 bps/day including breakfast - certainly much cheaper than a hotel. The room and bathroom were bare-bones and dated but clean. The beds were horrible - could feel every bed spring. The majority of other residents were visiting summer school students so it got very loud at times. Our big disappointment was finding that we could not access the LSE wireless internet service or use the computer room. The front desk was not helpful at all. Breakfast was fairly good. Overall, our stay was adequate but I don't think I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rekha65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in August. Its location is what prompted us to book. No hassle, very friendly. Room was very comfortable and clean as was the attached bathroom. Breakfast was plentiful (6 items plus unlimited bread, tea and coffee). Ask for back of the building for more "peace". Staff, however, not aware that on-street parking is FREE right on their doorstep on weekends; it's on Gloucester Way and is on BOTH sides of the street, running parallel with the Hall of Residence. Do NOT go to any of the local NCP etc car parks.

Reviews.Title: “Took some getting used to but on the whole a positive stay”
Reviews.Author: Bettie42
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter while she was attending an acting course. Check in was easy enough but a little friendlier would have been nice. The room smelled awful when we walked into it but we got used to it. Unisex bathrooms were unpleasant with broken toilet seats and as another reviewer has mentioned, plugs in the showers blocked with hairs etc. Kitchen was clean and I wouldn't have minded using it for tea, coffee or making a meal. The breakfast was really surprisingly good with plenty of hot drinks, toast and juice plus 6 other items from a wide selection. The room was small but adequate for our needs. The last night of a week was spoiled by the arrival of hundreds of spanish students who were blocking access to the stairs and lifts. The y then spent a good couple of hours in the evening runnning along the corridors and banging doors, also when I looked out one kid was going along trying all the door handles! Convenient for buses into the city centre and walkable as well. Cheap accomodation with good breakfast and good transport available but dont expect the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: ZenJen3000
Reviews.Content: I saw the other bad reviews and I feel there is some need for balance here. Just be aware that you are booking student accommodation for a good price in a good location + London hotels are generally pretty bad if you do not want to fork out lots of money. I was disappointed by the bathrooms. It was all very clean but far from my room. The showers were incredibly small and I found it hard to keep my clothes from getting wet. I had a feeling I would have been sharing with quite a number of rooms if it had been full. That could have meant they would be quite dirty. It is a great price for what you are getting. Just be aware of what you are actually booking.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: vadbai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed only for one night. The location is good and the price was very cheap. The rooms were very poorly decorated but the beds confortableand clean enough. Toilets and showers unisex (due to building work). The toilets were very urine smelling, quite unpleasant and in general not throurougly clean. Breakfast ok but staff were surly. Noisy all night. Staff on the telephone not very helpfull, but in person a lot worse. Ok it's cheap but lots of other cheap places.

Reviews.Title: “Not family-friendly; bathrooms are disgraceful and not that good value”
Reviews.Author: SK111097
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rosebury Hall for three nights to attend my sister's wedding. We chose the LSE because we have three young daughters (ages 10, 8 and 3) and couldn't afford a suite at nearby hotels. We booked two three-bed rooms. They smelt badly but were clean and tidied every day. The most difficult aspect of our stay was the bathrooms. As they were uni-sex, I had to accompany our children every time they wanted to visit the loo in case they were confronted by half-naked strangers emerging from the showers. The showers were appalling being nothing more than a pipe sticking out of the wall. The temperature varied drastically. They were not cleaned once and were littered with discarded bottles of shampoo; old razors and the plugs holes were clogged up with hair. Even though we had an extra bed, staff in the canteen were stingy with breakfast and there was nowhere to find a cup of tea or coffee at other times of the day. Because the hostel is not used by families, there was quite a lot of coming and going at 3am. Luckily the children were not woken. The location was excellent with regular buses on our doorstep. All in all, we'll be finding a Travelodge next time.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare stay in worse student digs I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: merrystar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a trainning weekend with 50 other women. It was hell, rooms were very poorly decorated with put you up type beds, Room smelt musty. Despite ensuite being booked none of our rooms were. Toilets and showers unisex (due to building work). Toilet seats broken and showers dirty. I was at uni 25 years ago and they were better halls then. Toilets long walk from room. Water in room not siutable for drinking, shared kitchens dirty. Confrence room boiling no windows or aircon, even the water in cooler was stale and smelt. Breakfast ok but staff were surly. Coffee machine in hall out of coffee and tea. Drunks in corridor. Noisy all night. Ok it's cheap but lots of other cheap places. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “for the buck worth it”
Reviews.Author: uconjak
Reviews.Content: My daughter was attending LSE for the summer session. I stayed in her room for 3 nites while in london. for 35 pounds sterling w/ breakfast.LSE bought a roll-a-way bed and it was very tight but, it was only a single room to begin with . I have no complaints. It is NOT a 5 star hotel. I was only in the room from 10pm till 7am. So no big deal. I enjoyed the stay. It has been along time since i stayed in a dorm situation. the bath and showering facilities took a little time to get use to. I am sure if you had a double or triple you would have more room ect. I was told that some of the LSE accomidations have some ensuite rooms. the bus stop was just outside the front door so transportation to major sites was not a big deal. Their is some good eating establishments nearby so i say the location was not a big deal either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price, excellent location in central London”
Reviews.Author: ghlance
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here with my students for one week per year, every year for the past 10 years. Yes, it is a college dorm, which helps on the price. This also means you can do laundry on site, and there is a pub, which is open most nights. Rooms are clean, warm, and safe. Breakfast is more than adequate. A few rooms are en-suite; most have shared bathrooms. Rooms in Myddleton Hall are better than those in Rosebery Hall (there are 2 sections on site), but you pay a little more. Staff is always helpful, and there is on-site security. Busses 19 and 38 (you never wait more than a couple of minutes) stop within just a few feet of Rosebery, and both take you into the heart of the West End. This is a great hostel at a great price. LSE (London School of Econ) has numerous other dorms in the Central London area, if this one is full.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation for little money”
Reviews.Author: Sohologist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rosebery Hall over New Years 2009/2010. I really enjoyed the stay at the RH. The room (single room) was clean, with a washing basin, and it was big enough, with a table and two soft chairs. The basin and litter got cleaned every day. Bathroom facilities (toilet and shower) are in the hall, and I had to share it with only 3 other rooms, but never met anyone there or had to wait to get in. also those facilities were always clean and got cleaned as well every day. The accommodation is also very quiet, you don´t hear any noises from the streets or any other noises, except maybe footsteps when someone walks in the hall. The staff members have all been very nice and kind and also very helpful. You can store your luggage when arriving before 2pm. Security is very high in this accommodation. Only those who stay there are able to get in. Others need to ring to get in (Staff from reception needs to open) The breakfast was really good. They stick with the 6 items you can get, but that is actually a lot, as you have many choices from bread rolls to cornflakes, bacon, eggs etc. toast and marmelade/honey are for free. Same as the drinks. Another positive aspect is that you can book single rooms there, for all those who travel alone The next Underground station (Angel) is only 5 minutes walk. And it only takes about 15 minutes with the tube to Picadilly Circus, Leicester Square etc. The area (Islington) itself is also very nice with lots of shops, supermarkets, restaurants and cafes. I really enjoyed the stay at the Rosebery Hall, and i can highly recommend this accommodation to all those who are looking for a cheap but good stay in London! I would and will always go back there when staying in London!

Reviews.Title: “excellent budget stay in london”
Reviews.Author: TIMELORDLeicester
Reviews.Content: basic but clean bedrooms seperete toliet and shower blocks very quiet location minuets walk from saddlers wells theatre islington 5 mins walk best thing of all is the excellent cookded breakfast deffintly would use again

Reviews.Title: “How broke are you?”
Reviews.Author: yogachai
Reviews.Content: I had spent a few nights at LSE's Passfield Hall and wanted to extend my stay, but they were booked up. The nice guy at the desk kindly called another LSE school and I was on my way, after (foolishly) putting down a nonrefundable deposit for 2 nights. There is nothing horribly wrong with Rosebery, if you are on a tight budget and don't mind Motel 6. The rooms were very clean, but things like the carpet and the furniture looked as thought they could've been replaced a number of years ago. My view was of the building behind, which looked more like a tenament than anything else. Also, as the cheapest of the LSE dorms, it seems to attract large groups of traveling students, and that's fine for them! Overall, too dingy, too old, too smelly, too depressing to feel like I'd want to come home even to spend a few hours here.

Reviews.Title: “It left a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: usacobbler
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my Roseberry Hall experience and it left a lot to be desired. I will say on the plus side the staff were lovely and very helpful and professional. The location is great. It is only about a 10-15 minutes walk from Angel Tube station and it is a lovely area with some great pubs and restaurants. The single room was a nice size and it was clean and had its own sink as well. In short, if you want to get a decent night sleep and have some level of comfort then this is NOT the place for you. When I booked (I was attending a workshop there hence why I chose this accommodation) they did not tell me that it would be full of college students attending the summer session of the LSE. The noise did not abate until at least 1 am. Logic tells me this is what college students do (at least I sure did!) so if I had known that I would not have stayed there. I have stayed in other college residences and they were not being used for students hence why I didn’t think this would be the case here. Also, when I was going to my room I was struck by some bad smells in the hall ways although there was no obvious reason for these smells since the rugs appeared to be clean and fairly new. Next, I discovered that there was only one bathroom (2 stalls, 1 shower and a very old looking bathtub) for each gender on the entire hall. I was stunned at how the bin in the ladies was over flowing and how the bathroom had a very strong small of urine. Breakfast, as was mentioned, was large and varied. The temperature was luke warm at best. This is a great place if these things are not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - student hall of residence”
Reviews.Author: Pavement-Walker
Reviews.Content: This really is a student hall of residence, and feels like it, although much better furnished than in my day. It is built around a small garden, with a modest communal "pub" and a dining room below street level. Standard, nourishing, LSE breakfast - choice of six items from a range including fruit, yoghurt, cooked bacon eggs sausage etc. The location is ideal for Sadlers Wells, being about three minutes walk, and Islington - the Angel is less than 10 minutes walk. A major London bus route, the 19, goes down Roseberry. Although there did not seem to be much traffic at the weekend, the room on the third floor seemed to be noisy with traffic noise. And of course in a place like this one is at the mercy of fellow residents - if a group come back after midnight, you will probably wake up. Being a student hall, it is only available during holiday periods, but that includes the summer. The LSE website is very good and makes a booking an easy task. And you don't have to pay more than a small deposit up front.

HotelInfo.Name: Rosebery Hall Residence
HotelInfo.Address: 90 Rosebery Avenue, London EC1R 4TY, England
